intro: Echinocystis longispina, commonly known as the long-spined cucumber, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a climbing vine characterized by its hairy, branched stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow, fragrant flowers that give way to spiny, orange-colored fruits. Its fruit is typically 10–20 cm long and contains a single, large, edible seed. This species is native to the Americas and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forests.
